title: Presidential Nominations and Withdrawal Sent to the Senate | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
November 09, 2015

 



Presidential Nominations and Withdrawal Sent to the Senate





	NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE:

	Robert Annan Riley III, of Florida, a Career Member of the Senior Foreign Service, Class of Minister-Counselor, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Federated States of Micronesia.

	Karen Bevard Stewart, of Florida, a Career Member of the Senior Foreign Service, Class of Minister-Counselor, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Republic of the Marshall Islands.

	Vik Edwin Stoll, of Missouri, to be a Judge of the United States Tax Court for a term of fifteen years, vice James S. Halpern, retired.

	WITHDRAWAL SENT TO THE SENATE:

	Kenneth J. Kopocis, of Virginia, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, vice Peter Silva Silva, resigned, which was sent to the Senate on June 24, 2015.
